newsitem.title: UK: UK's Darling says budget steps to reduce pressure.
newsitem.headline: UK's Darling says budget steps to reduce pressure.

text.p: Alistair Darling, chief secretary to the British Treasury, said on Wednesday the government had taken steps necessary to reduce inflation pressures that have been building up in the British economy.
"The Chancellor has announced measures that we believe will resolve inflationary pressures that we face at the present time," Darling said in an interview on Reuters Financial Television (RFTV).

"In any recovery you find that consumer spending starts to grow quite rapidly, whereas the investment levels -- the building of the capacity in the economy -- lags some way behind," Darling said, following British Chancellor of the Exchequer Gordon Brown's first budget.
"And the result is that we've had this terrible cycle of booms followed by busts. We want to stop that," he said.
Darling said the government had laid the foundations for long-term growth.
"We've taken the necessary steps to ensure the fiscal tightening that was necessary to reduce some of the pressures that are now building up," he said.
